alert.note: Alert for Bailey; Cochran; Hockley; Lamb (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 02 at 4:52PM CDT until June 02 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lubbock has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Bailey County in northwestern Texas... Southeastern Cochran County in northwestern Texas... Western Hockley County in northwestern Texas... Southwestern Lamb County in northwestern Texas... * Until 530 PM CDT. * At 452 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated isolated thunderstorms producing very heavy rain. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Levelland, Littlefield, Morton, Pep, Lehman, Whitharral, Whiteface and Opdyke West. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
